title: Bradford City latest club to launch racism investigation following incident against Port Vale
text:
Bradford City have become the sixth British club to launch racism investigations this week alone after an alleged attack by a fan before Tuesday night's home defeat to Port Vale.

The Sky Bet League Two club said it had made contact with the victim's family after an incident close to the Utilita Energy Stadium. In May, Bradford City investigated reports of alleged racist abuse towards local residents outside Valley Parade before a 0-0 draw against AFC Wimbledon.

In a statement appealing for witnesses over the fresh incident, the club said: "City officials have [on Wednesday morning] made contact with the alleged victim's family and, alongside local authorities, will be conducting an inquiry. The incident occurred on Manningham Lane in the build-up to kick-off and the club is appealing for witnesses to come forward."

The case follows a weekend of abuse at almost every level of the game, including against Haringey players during their FA Cup qualifier against Yeovil. There was also racist chanting by Bristol City fans against Luton and allegations in Scotland that Rangers striker Alfredo Morelos was targeted by Hearts fans. Subsequent investigations were launched by Manchester United into an allegation of abuse against Trent Alexander-Arnold, and Northampton into claims of discriminatory chanting by Salford.
description: Bradford City have become the sixth British club to launch racism investigations this week alone after an alleged attack by a fan before Tuesday night's home defeat to Port Vale.
